entry.title: Bybit Shuts Down Operations In France Following Regulatory Heat
entry.summary:
Bybit, a well-known cryptocurrency exchange, said it would stop serving French users on August 2. This was a surprise move that shows how strict regulators are becoming.
The decision comes after the Autorité des Marchés Financiers (AMF), France’s financial watchdog, put more and more pressure on the company. Bybit’s operations will be greatly limited, which is a very important time for the exchange and its French customers.
Restrictions Pile Up
French users will have to deal with a lot of strict restrictions. Bybit has declared all accounts to be “close-only,” which means that users can’t open new positions or buy things. Bybit wrote an in-depth blog post about how it was ending a number of services, such as One-click buy, P2P deals, spot dealing, and derivative trading. Making dep…

entry.title: ‘Unregulated’ Crypto Betting Booms Ahead Of 2024 US Election On Polymarket
entry.summary:
As the 2024 US presidential race heats up, a new frontier for political betting has emerged in the crypto world. Platforms like Polymarket, Kalshi, and PredictIt are seeing a surge in wagers on election outcomes, even as US regulators crack down on these activities.
At the heart of this trend is Polymarket, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform that allows users to bet on everything from election winners to the possibility of alien disclosure.
Crypto Betting Frenzy On Polymarket
According to a recent Bloomberg report, the amount of open wagers on Polymarket related to US election outcomes has soared by over 500% in recent months, approaching the $1 billion mark.
According to the report, this surge in activity has been driven in part by “high-profile events” like President Joe …

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining Giants from Wall Street: Ranking the Top 5 by Market Cap
entry.summary: Over 20 companies engaged in Bitcoin (BTC) mining, the process of extracting the oldest cryptocurrency for profit, are now listed on global stock exchanges. Wall Street is home to the vast majority of them, and it's where we find the largest publicly traded BTC miners. But which one is the biggest? Let's find out! Who is the Largest Bitcoin Miner on Wall Street? Marathon Digital Holdings (NASDAQ: MARA) is the undisputed leader in the industry, with a market capitalization approaching $6 billion. The company's stock has gained more than fivefold since its low at the end of the crypto winter, currently trading at around $20 per share. CleanSpark (NASDAQ: CLSK) takes second place with a market capitalization of $3.7 billion. The company has been around since 1987 but o…

entry.title: Beware The Crypto Con: FBI Warns Of Rising Exchange Impersonation Scams
entry.summary:
Amid the growing adoption of cryptocurrency, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has highlighted a worrying trend: scammers masquerading as legitimate cryptocurrency exchange employees. While this scamming process might be old news, the report revealed these scammers might have employed new tactics, highlighting the evolving methods by which these malicious actors attempt to breach user accounts and steal funds.
How The Crypto Scammers Operate
According to the detailed warnings issued by the FBI, these fraudsters initiate contact through phone calls or electronic messages. After they have been able to get hold of a victim via the call or text message, they cleverly disguise themselves as support staff from well-known crypto exchanges, claiming that they need to address issues wit…

entry.title: BALL Crypto Scam? Former NBA Player’s RWA Project Accused Of $330,000 Rug Pull
entry.summary:
Former NBA player Scottie Pippen launched the Game 5 Ball (BALL) project, a real-world asset (RWA) project to tokenize the “legendary 1991 Game 5 championship ball.” After the launch, Pippen and the project were accused of rugging over 100 Ether (ETH) and being involved in other crypto scams. Now, Game 5 Ball’s team claims an alleged attack is responsible for the incident.
Game 5 Championship Ball Immortalized On The Blockchain
Basketball legend Scottie Pippen recently announced the launch of his Game 5 Ball RWA project. The crypto project aims to bring the “iconic piece of sports history to the blockchain for the first time” and preserve the ball’s legacy, “which marked the start of the Bulls’ dynasty, and is driven by the community.”
Related Reading: US Senator Says VP Harris Crypt…

entry.title: Fantom Rebrands To Sonic Labs, Gears Up For Highly Anticipated EVM Chain Launch
entry.summary:
Decentralized smart contract platform Fantom has undergone a transformation, rebranding itself as Sonic Labs in preparation for the upcoming launch of Sonic, an Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). The rebrand was officially announced via X on August 1, with Sonic Labs now fully operational across all platforms.
Fantom’s Transformation Into Sonic Labs
This rebranding marks a new milestone in Sonic Labs’ roadmap toward the launch of Sonic, scheduled for later this year. According to the protocol, the move is intended to provide greater clarity and visibility to the project’s community, which includes FTM holders, network developers, and validators.
The core of Fantom’s transformation lies in the Sonic upgrade, a reportedly “cutting-edge technology” designed to “revolutionize” the platfor…

In the current cycle, meme coins have managed to overshadow utility coins, with the likes of Dogecoin and Shiba Inu remaining prominent players. entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$534m. ETH outperforms slightly as 9 ETFs set to launch. Grayscale moves $1bn ETH to Coinbase for outflows. Biggest BlackRock ETF inflow day in 4 months. Mt Gox moves $2.8bn BTC for distributions. US government moves $4m BTC to Coinbase. Bedford FC buys $4.5m BTC. Hamilton Lane launches private credit fund on SOL. CNBC discusses BTC reserve currency rumour. Polymarket sets another trading record. BlockFi administrator submits plan to repay customers. WLD denies insider trading and manipulation claims. India keeps high crypto taxes unchanged. Gate exchange exits Japan. Marathon Digital fined $138m for breaching NDA. HyperLend launches lending on HyperLiquid.

entry.title: Mika Shares How to Sell Crypto Using Kraken Wallet
entry.summary: Rug Radio creator Mika guides you through the process of selling crypto and transferring it back to your bank account.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 163 - JOEVER FOR BYEDEN
entry.summary: Crypto dips then bounces on Biden-Harris switch. SOL again leads, DEX volume eclipses ETH + BNB. Biden news had led to $67m liquidations. Democrats have chance to ‘regain crypto vote’. Mt Gox transfers to Bitstamp expected soon. Crypto sees $3.2bn fund inflows in 3 weeks. China company Boyaa buys $100m BTC. Polymarket saw $80m bets on Biden withdrawal. Polymarket 2024 volumes hit $500m. Elon appearance at Bitcoin Nashville rumoured. Combined SOL, BTC & ETH ETF coming: Geraci. Call skew heads to 2024 extremes in bullish sign. Plan B points to bullish setup in S2F model. Coinbase premium moves back to positive. Gensler likely resigns next year: 10x. Germany already lost $124m profit selling.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Do Crypto Degens Care About Being Scammed?
entry.summary: What's the Meta? With the rise of Pumpdotfun and rug pulls becoming a daily occurrence, why do crypto degens keep investing? Do these investors enjoy being scammed? It appears that people very often invest in meme coins that are very obviously going to rug pull. Once it happens, they just laugh it off on Twitter, is being scammed fun?!

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 162 - SOLANA LEADS THE CHARGE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$85m. SOL leads majors ahead of ETH ETF. Rumours Trump may want BTC in strategic reserve. Trump BTC round-table tickets going for $845k. Polymarket hits volume record of $20m. ETH ETFs will get steady capital: Binance CEO. Winklevii donate $1m to try and unseat Warren. Tornado sees $1.9bn volume resurgence. New overlay attacks growing in crypto. Messari co-founder faces backlash on views. Raydium integrates with Moonpay. Tencent leads investment round in Chainbase. ZA Bank partners with stablecoin issuers.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 161 - THE BIG WIF COMEBACK?
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$53m. Crypto remains stable despite macro sell-off. ETH ETF providers undercut each other on fees. Grayscale keeps 2.5% high fee, launches mini-fund. Grayscale launches ‘Decentralised AI Fund’. Dimon may be ‘changing tune’ on Bitcoin. Many alts now bounced 50-90% from lows. Vote implies 55% of Mt. Gox depositors won’t sell. BlockFi to make creditor distributions this month. WazirX exchanges sees $230m suspected breach. Vitalik warns against voting ‘pro-crypto’. Vitalik & Autism Capital trade barbs. Bitcoin Magazine to hold pro-Trump fundraiser. State Street explore blockchain payments. UPbit sees 44% monthly drop in volume.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 160 - CHATTING TO ROBINHOOD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$423m. Crypto pushes higher, biggest ETF inflow in 6 weeks. Mt. Gox FUD ‘overestimated’ as whales accumulate. Kraken to begin Mt. Gox repayments in 7-14d. ETH spot ETFs will push ETH to $5k: Bitwise. SOL ETF will be next: Bloomberg. XRP up 35% this week ahead of potential settlement. Aethir reports $36m H1 customer revenue. Craig Wright now under threat of perjury & forgery. FTX & CFTC in $12.7bn settlement. WLD up 40% after delaying unlock schedule. Helio announces instant crypto fiat commerce. Phantom pauses cross-chain swaps amid exploit.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 159 - MEMECOINS GO MAD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$301m. BTC dips from $65k as $6bn moves from Mt. Gox. Coinbase & MicroStrategy surge with BTC. Genesis sells another $38m BTC. ETH ETF timeline delayed until July 23rd. Trump chooses crypto friendly Vance as VP. Old clip shows Vance bashing Gensler on crypto. Bitcoin is good during debasement: Larry Fink. Michael Dell calls Fink video ‘fascinating’. Fear & Greed index shifts to Greed. Tether mints $1bn USDT on Tron. Stripe expands crypto integration to the EU.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 158 - A WILD WEEKEND FOR BITCOIN
entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. XRP vs SEC press conference rumoured on 18th. Crypto funds saw $1.44B inflows last week. Rumours China is to ‘unban BTC’ in Q4. S. Korea may delay crypto taxes until 2028. Russia to allow crypto trading on stock exchange. All altcoin categories outperform BTC over 7d. BitConnect infamous promoter convicted. Scroll becomes 8th L2 with TVL over $1bn. ETHFI Season 2 claims available this week. Base hits record 1m UserOps in a week.

entry.title: Zoltan Istvan on AI and Human Immortality
entry.summary: Transhumanist Party founder Zoltan Istvan chats with Decrypt's Emerging Technology report Jason Nelson about his journey with transhumanism, running for office, and why he fears AI is outpacing life science and poses a threat to the quest for immortality.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 157 - ROLLBIT FRIDAY!
entry.summary: The German state sells $2bn+ BTC and has under $300m left. BTC ETF sees $800M of inflows, Mr 100 keeps buying. SOL ETF deadline set for 2025, election could be key. SOL stablecoin TVL soars on Tether & PYUSD growth. Firedancer sees the first accepted block on SOL testnet. ETH ETFs finally expected next week. Monthly active crypto addresses top 100m. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville conference. Golman Sachs to launch 3 tokenization projects. Short squeeze in altcoins sees TIA rise 80% from lows. MOG leads top memes coins, BONK flips WIF. Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.
